question: Q1 Here is a list of jobs that people you know may have. These people could be family or relatives, close friends or someone else you know. By 'knowing' a person, we mean that you know him/ her by name and well enough to contact him/ her. If you know several people who have a job from the list below, please only choose the person who you feel closest to. Each of these jobs could be held by a woman or a man. Do you know a woman or a man who is…?   Q1a A bus/ lorry driver

Q2 To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?   Q2a Differences in income in [COUNTRY] are too large.

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question: Q2 To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?   Q2b For a society to be fair, differences in people's standard of living should be small.

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question: Q2 To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?   Q2c It is the responsibility of the government to reduce the differences in income between people with high incomes and those with low incomes.

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question: Q3 People have different opinions on who should provide services in [COUNTRY]. Who do you think should primarily provide health care for the sick?
Q4 And, who do you think should primarily provide care for older people?

Q5 Some activities are done with others in organised groups, clubs or associations. The next questions are about your participation, if any, in such activities. In the past 12 months, how often, if at all, have you taken part in activities…?   Q5a … of groups or associations for leisure, sports or culture?

answer.2: One to three times a month
answer.3: Several times in the past year

question: Q5 Some activities are done with others in organised groups, clubs or associations. The next questions are about your participation, if any, in such activities. In the past 12 months, how often, if at all, have you taken part in activities…?   Q5b … of political parties, political groups or political associations?

answer.2: One to three times a month

question: Q5 Some activities are done with others in organised groups, clubs or associations. The next questions are about your participation, if any, in such activities. In the past 12 months, how often, if at all, have you taken part in activities…?   Q5c … of charitable or religious organisations that do voluntary work?

answer.2: One to three times a month

question: Q6 To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People like me don't have any say about what the government does.

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question: Q7 This section is about who you would turn to for help in different situations, if you needed it. For each of the following situations, please choose one to say who you would turn to first. If there are several people you are equally likely to turn to, please choose the one you feel closest to. Who would you turn to first to ...   Q7a … help you with a household or a garden job that you can't do yourself?

If there are several people you are equally likely to turn to, please choose the one you feel closest to. Who would you turn to first to ... Q9 The next questions are about how you feel about different aspects of your life. For each one, please indicate how often during the past 4 weeks you have felt that way. How often in the past 4 weeks have you felt that …   Q9a … you lack companionship?

Q10 How often do you think that people would try to take advantage of you if they got the chance, and how often would they try to be fair?

answer.1: Try to take advantage almost all of the time
answer.2: Try to take advantage most of the time
answer.3: Try to be fair most of the time
answer.4: Try to be fair almost all of the time

question: Q11 Generally speaking, would you say that people can be trusted or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?

answer.1: People can almost always be trusted
answer.3: You usually can't be too careful in dealing with people
answer.4: You almost always can't be too careful in dealing with people

question: Q12 Using the following scale ranging from 1 to 5 where 1 means 'No trust at all' and 5 means 'Complete trust', please indicate how much trust you personally have in…? How much trust do you personally have in …   Q12a ... [COUNTRY]'s courts?

Q12 Using the following scale ranging from 1 to 5 where 1 means 'No trust at all' and 5 means 'Complete trust', please indicate how much trust you personally have in…? How much trust do you personally have in …   Q12b … major private companies in [COUNTRY]?

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question: Q13 To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?   Q13b You should take care of yourself and your family first, before helping other people.

JP.3: Can't say one way or the other

question: Q13 To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?   Q13c People who are better off should help friends who are less well off.

question: Q14 In general, do your family members put pressure on you about the way you live or organise your personal life?
Q15 Do you feel that your family, relatives and/ or friends make too many demands on you?

Q16 Thinking about the important people in your life, such as your spouse or partner, your family members, or close friends, how often in the past 4 weeks did any of these people act angry or upset with you?
Q17 How often do you go out to eat or drink with three or more friends or acquaintances who are not family members?

answer.4: Two or three times a month

question: Q19 Please indicate about how many people do you have contact with on a typical weekday irrespective of whether you know them or not. Include anyone you chat with, talk to, or text, either face-to-face, by phone, internet or any other communication device.
Q20 About how many of these people do you see face-to-face on a typical weekday?

answer.1: All or almost all of them
answer.5: None or almost none of them

question: Q21 Please think about the parent you have contact with most frequently: How often do you have contact with that parent, either face-to-face, by phone, internet or any other communication device?

answer.4: Two to three times a month
answer.95: My parents are no longer alive
answer.96: The parent I have contact with the most frequently lives with me

question: Q22 Think about the brother or sister you have contact with most frequently: How often do you have contact with that brother or sister, either face-to-face, by phone, internet or any other communication device?

answer.4: Two to three times a month
answer.95: I do not have any brothers or sisters
answer.96: The brother or sister I have contact with the most frequently lives with me

question: Q23 Think about your adult child you have contact with most frequently: How often do you have contact with this child aged at least 18, either face-to-face, by phone, internet or any other communication device?

answer.4: Two to three times a month
answer.95: I do not have any adult children
answer.96: The adult child I have contact with the most frequently lives with me

question: Q24 Now, think about the other family member you have contact with most frequently, aside of your spouse or partner, parents, siblings or adult children. How often do you have contact with that family member, either face-to-face, by phone, internet or any other communication device?

answer.4: Two to three times a month
answer.95: I do not have other family members
answer.96: The other family member I have contact with the most frequently lives with me

question: Q25 And, think about the close friend you have contact with most frequently: How often do you have contact with that close friend, either face-to-face, by phone, internet or any other communication device?

answer.4: Two to three times a month
answer.95: I do not have any close friends
answer.96: The close friend I have contact with the most frequently lives with me

question: Q26 Think about the occasions when you talk, get in touch with your family members and your close friends. How many times does this happen in the form of a text message/ a cell phone conversation or another internet communication tool?

answer.1: All or almost all of it
answer.5: None or almost none of it
answer.7: I do not use any of these devices

question: Q27 In general, would you say your health is…?
Q28 During the past 4 weeks how often…   Q28a … have you felt unhappy and depressed?
Q28 During the past 4 weeks how often…   Q28b … have you felt difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them?
Q29 To what extent is the following statement true or untrue for you? It is easy for me to accomplish my goals.
Q30 All things considered, how satisfied are you with your life as a whole nowadays?
Q31 Thinking of your household's total income, including all the sources of income of all the members who contribute to it, how difficult or easy is it currently for your household to make ends meet?
Q32 How many languages do you speak well enough to hold a conversation in, including the language(s) you speak at home?
